content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"What is an RFC?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#9BC837\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"RFC is an acronym for 'Request for Comments'. It is a documentation and communication device used to discuss and polish an idea prior to implementation. It provides a basic description of a problem, proposed implementation with high and/or low-level detail, and a roadmap for seeing the implementation move from idea to reality.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"How will RFCs help us?\\r\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#9BC837\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Writing things down\\r\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}},{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-underlined\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Documentation is a constant challenge and often seen as unnecessary, but writing things down is a powerful tool to help ensure a successful plan for what to build. And once we know what and how we're building something, the execution should be more straight forward.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Spreading information and knowledge\\r\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}},{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-underlined\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"With knowledge and expertise spread across our distributed teams in several different countries and time zones, it is difficult to know what everyone is working on, as well as how teams are implementing functionality or what kind of technical debt is being accrued. Additionally, technical decisions big and small are being made all the time, and this process provides a mechanism to federate information out to the larger group as a means to potentially reduce double work, allow team members to learn from others through this documentation, and to allow for an iterative process where collaboration and feedback help evolve a solution or implementation.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\rGetting feedback\\r\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}},{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-underlined\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"On a 2 week cadence, all new RFCs ready for feedback will be emailed out to the entire global technology group. For RFCs that need more immediate or quicker feedback, please contact the Architecture team for expedited distribution. RFC creators can specify specific team members who they want to see feedback from, but the larger intent is to spread this information to everyone so that anyone can review and provide feedback or additional guidance. Feedback occurs as comments on the individual RFC page, and the RFC will be updated as the discussion evolves to always reflect the current state of the proposal.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
